comments.author: Mike Wins

comments.text:
Quote from Mike Wins, Mar 26:

"That's fucking disgusting, and this is why *the Black race sucks*, they 
are destroyed, their men, and women are separate, and are the *laughing 
stock of the damn planet*.

I knew Trollstation were some prejudice ass fucks, I could tell that by 
your past videos when you have those *Negroes* do the worse, and most 
embarrassing shit, when it is your damn idea instead of theirs.

But, you cannot blame Whites, these *Negroes* is doing to themselves, 
embarrassing, and making fools of themselves, I don't give a damn if this 
is a troll video or not, that's just some bullshit, and not a funny prank."

So apparently black people are your "family" now?  I'm very glad not to be 
related to you.  Let me explain racism from the point of view of the 
different races in America for you:

(i) If you're a white person (62% of pop.) racist against non-whites, you 
hate 38% of Americans.  Stupid.
(ii) If you're an African American (13% of pop.) racist against non-afro 
americans, you hate 87% of Americans.  Very stupid.
(iii) If you're Native American (1% of pop.), and racist against everyone 
not a native American, *you hate 99% of Americans*.  MORONIC.

I guess some people are so bitter and twisted, they just want to see the 
world burn.  Well, go ahead and try; it's obvious you are too weak and 
cowardly to do it yourself, and people are too clever to fall for this 
race-baiting shit.  I would tell you to "Go to hell", but I think you're 
already there, in a hell of your own making.  I pity you.

comments.author: Chelsea Benoit

comments.text:
As someone of white and "Native American" heritage I will definitely agree 
that the Indians got screwed.  The way they were treated was very messed up 
and still is.  However, it doesn't have any bearing on the illegal 
immigration debate.  There was no immigration law back then.  There was no 
country.  There was never a unified country of Indians.  There was this 
mass of land known as North America which was full of tribes of various 
sizes who occupied different patches of land, many of whom were nomadic, 
many of whom warred with each other.  Indians say, "You cannot own the 
land," but then they turn around and claim that white people stole it from 
them.  Which is it?  If you can't own the land, then it can't be stolen 
from you.

Seriously, though, what happened to the Indians was wrong, but that's how 
migration and nation building has been done since the beginning of time.  
Two people want one plot of land... they fight over it, to the victor the 
spoils.  The Indians migrated here from Asia... guess what?  They killed 
the people who were here before them, the descendents of African emigrants 
who resembled Australia's aboriginals.  That's just the way it is.  We have 
borders.  We have a governmental system.  We have to have immigration 
laws.  Imagine if tomorrow everyone said, hey let's move to America, and 
then you had 8 billion people all trying to fit into New York city... it 
wouldn't work out to well.  We need to be able to defend our borders and 
allow people into the country in a balanced, orderly way that's as fair to 
as many people as possible.﻿

comments.author: Denise White

comments.text:
+C. hawk The mainstream doesn't want to be "railroaded" by special-interest 
groups and resents favoritism given to those groups. That seems reasonable. 
The execution of treaties should be made pliable. Honoring the treaties is 
obviously paramount, but there should be clauses that don't burden the 
innocent. 


In some U.S. states, where the tribe is recognized as official by those 
states, tribal members are exempt from sales tax. If a tribal member sells 
goods and services off the reservation, then he/she is subject to sales 
tax. On the reservation, a sales tax is imposed or not at the will of the 
tribe if the seller is a tribal member ---- a non-tribal member seller must 
collect sales tax.
